p: Crop wild relatives (CWR) are those undomesticated “cousins” of cultivated crop lines that represent a potential untapped genetic resource that could be used as a means to adapt to new pests or abiotic changes, including, at least theoretically, increased levels of CO 2. Of course, there are no directed efforts to adapt CWR to the recent increase in CO 2; however, it is worth determining if any evolutionary adaptive changes that have allowed CWRs to adapt to recent CO 2 increases have occurred.
